name: Brooklyn Banks
description: Legendary brick banks under the Brooklyn Bridge on-ramp. One of the most iconic skate spots in history. The angled brick embankments provide perfect natural transitions for wallrides, bank tricks, and creative lines.
features: banks, ledges, manual pads, stairs

name: Tompkins Square Park
description: Classic East Village park with a longstanding skate-friendly culture. Smooth paths, varied ledge heights, and a welcoming atmosphere make it accessible for all skill levels.
features: flat ground, benches, manual pads, curbs

name: LES Skatepark
description: Official concrete skatepark under the Manhattan Bridge. A well-designed mix of street and transition elements that serves as one of Manhattan's primary skateparks.
features: bowl, quarter pipes, ledges, rails, flat bars

name: Chelsea Piers Skatepark
description: Indoor/covered skatepark at Chelsea Piers sports complex along the Hudson River.
features: mini ramp, quarter pipes, rails, ledges

name: Astor Place
description: Iconic NYC plaza with the Alamo cube sculpture. Smooth ground and skateable ledges.
features: flat ground, ledges, marble benches, manual pads

name: Federal Plaza
description: Massive government plaza with perfect granite ledges. Heavily skated in videos but security is aggressive.
features: granite ledges, flat ground, stairs, gaps

name: Owl's Head Skatepark
description: Well-built concrete skatepark in Owl's Head Park with harbor views. One of Brooklyn's best skateparks featuring both transition and street elements.
features: bowl, snake run, ledges, rails, quarter pipes

name: McCarren Skatepark
description: Popular Williamsburg skatepark in McCarren Park. Great street-style layout.
features: ledges, rails, flat bars, manual pads, quarter pipes

name: DUMBO Skate Spot
description: Cobblestone-adjacent flat areas under the Manhattan Bridge in DUMBO with various skateable architecture.
features: ledges, flat ground, banks, curbs

name: Prospect Park Skate Circle
description: Smooth park loops and the skate circle area near the bandshell. Great for cruising and flat ground tricks.
features: flat ground, smooth paths, gentle slopes

name: Flushing Meadows Skatepark
description: Large concrete skatepark in Flushing Meadows Corona Park near the Unisphere.
features: bowl, rails, ledges, quarter pipes, stairs

name: Rockaway Beach Skatepark
description: Beachside bowl-heavy park with deep transition. One of the gnarliest parks in NYC.
features: bowl, snake run, pool coping, deep end, extensions

name: Astoria Park Skatepark
description: Solid neighborhood skatepark under the Hell Gate Bridge in Astoria Park.
features: ledges, rails, quarter pipes, manual pads

name: Mullaly Skatepark
description: One of the best skateparks in NYC. Deep bowls with excellent flow, a quality street section, and top-tier concrete work. The Bronx's crown jewel of skating.
features: bowl, pool coping, spine, hips, deep transitions, street section

name: River Park Skatepark
description: Neighborhood park along the Bronx River with a compact but fun skate area.
features: ledges, rails, quarter pipes, flat bars

name: Stapleton Skatepark
description: Staten Island's primary skatepark near the waterfront. Compact street-style layout.
features: ledges, rails, quarter pipes, manual pads, flat bars

name: Pier 62 Skatepark
description: Free public skatepark on Pier 62 in Hudson River Park. Great river views and solid design.
features: bowl, ledges, rails, stairs, banks, flat bars

name: Cooper Park Skatepark
description: Neighborhood skatepark in Cooper Park. Small but well-maintained with a friendly local scene.
features: ledges, rails, quarter pipes, manual pads

name: Washington Heights Banks
description: Steep streets and concrete banks in the Heights. Raw street skating with amazing hill bombs.
features: banks, ledges, stairs, gaps

name: Red Hook DIY Spot
description: Community-built DIY spot in Red Hook's industrial waterfront area. Raw, creative, and constantly evolving.
features: DIY ramps, concrete transitions, ledges, creative obstacles

name: Midtown Courthouse Banks
description: Marble banks and ledges around Midtown courthouses. Classic spot but heavy security.
features: banks, ledges, flat ground, stairs

name: Hunts Point DIY
description: Bronx DIY spot built by local skaters in Hunts Point industrial area. Gritty and authentic.
features: DIY ramps, flat bars, manual pads, creative features

name: The OG Manhattan
description: Hit the most iconic Manhattan skate spots in one legendary day — from the Brooklyn Banks to Tompkins, through LES and finishing at Astor Place. This is the route every NYC skater should ride at least once.
features: brooklyn-banks, les-skatepark, tompkins-square-park, astor-place

name: Brooklyn Bridge to Banks
description: Cross the Brooklyn Bridge on your board, hit the Banks, then loop through downtown Manhattan's best street spots. Touristy? Maybe. Epic? Absolutely.
features: dumbo-spot, brooklyn-banks, federal-plaza

name: Williamsburg to Bushwick
description: Brooklyn's creative corridor — from McCarren Park's modern skatepark through the street art of Bushwick to the DIY energy of Cooper Park. This route is pure Brooklyn.
features: mccarren-skatepark, cooper-park, red-hook-diy
